intro: Smilax chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté smilax, is a climbing shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Smilacaceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
